Text: The LORD is my light and my salvation—whom shall I fear? The LORD is the stronghold of my life—of whom shall I be afraid?
Context: David expresses his complete trust in the LORD, portraying Him as his light, salvation, and fortress.

Text: When evildoers came against me to devour my flesh, my foes and my enemies stumbled and fell.
Context: David recounts his enemies’ aggression and their ultimate downfall, implying God‘s protection over him.

Text: Though an army encamps around me, my heart will not fear; though a war breaks out against me, even then will I be confident.
Context: David speaks of remaining fearless and confident despite being surrounded by threats and conflict.

Text: One thing I have asked of the LORD; this is what I desire: to dwell in the house of the LORD all the days of my life, to gaze on the beauty of the LORD and seek Him in His temple.
Context: David expresses a singular, earnest desire to be in God’s presence continually.

Text: For in the day of trouble He will hide me in His shelter; He will conceal me under the cover of His tent; He will set me high upon a rock.
Context: David conveys his assurance that God will protect and elevate him above his troubles.

Text: Then my head will be exalted above the enemies who surround me; at His tabernacle I will offer sacrifices with shouts of joy; I will sing and make music to the LORD.
Context: David anticipates victory and worshipful celebration in the presence of God.

Text: Hear, O LORD, when I cry aloud; be gracious to me and answer me.
Context: David implores God to listen and respond to him with graciousness, indicating a moment of earnest seeking.

Text: To You my heart says, ”Seek His face.“ Your face, LORD, I will seek.
Context: David resolves to seek God‘s presence in response to an inward prompting.

Text: Do not hide Your face from me, do not turn Your servant away in anger; You have been my helper. Do not reject me or forsake me, O God my Savior.
Context: David expresses fear of abandonment and pleads for God’s continual presence and help.

Text: Though my father and mother forsake me, the LORD will receive me.
Context: David declares his confidence that, even if his closest relations abandon him, the LORD will not.

Text: Teach me Your way, O LORD, and lead me on a level path, because of my oppressors.
Context: David seeks guidance and a smooth path from the LORD, possibly to avoid pitfalls set by his enemies.

Text: Do not hand me over to the will of my foes, for false witnesses rise up against me, breathing out violence.
Context: David articulates concern over his adversaries‘ desires and false testimony against him.

Text: I am still confident of this: I will see the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living.
Context: David affirms a hope that goes beyond his present troubles; he believes he will witness God’s goodness in his lifetime.

Text: Wait for the LORD; be strong and take heart and wait for the LORD.
Context: David concludes with advice to remain patient and courageous while waiting for the LORD‘s intervention.
